Calculates engine speed based on signal from ECM
Calculates distance vehicle is driven or distance since trip meter knob is pressed

Indicates engine coolant temperature based on signal from ECM

Illuminates when headlight dimmer switch is set to HIGH or FLASH
Illuminates when receiving malfunction signal from ECM
Illuminates when receiving malfunction signal from generator
Illuminates when receiving oil press is abnormally low (pressure switch is ON) signal
Illuminates when receiving signal that parking brake switch is ON and brake fluid level warning switch is ON
Illuminates when receiving fuel empty signal from fuel sender gauge
Illuminates when receiving each door courtesy switch signal

Buzzer is ON when ignition switch is off, light control switch is set to TAIL or HEAD and driver side door is open
Buzzer is ON when shift lever moved to R

step2.ptxt: Built-in buzzer for the reminder system (light*1, key*1 and reverse*2)

item.ptxt: The warning buzzer sounds when: 1) a key is in the ignition key cylinder, the ignition switch is off and the driver side door is open; or 2) the light control switch is set to TAIL or HEAD, the ignition switch is off and the driver side door is open; and 3) the ignition switch ON, and shift lever moved to R.
Press and release the knob to scroll through the trip "A", trip "B" and odometer figures.
Press and hold the knob to reset the trip meter.

The multi-display provides the following information: 1) outside temperature*4; 2) average fuel consumption for a certain distance; 3) instantaneous fuel consumption; 4) average speed for a certain distance; 5) runnable distance with the remaining amount of fuel; 6) compass; and 7) elapsed time since the ignition switch was turned ON.
Press INFO to change the display item.
Press RESET to clear the stored data.
Press H to adjust the hour of the clock.
Press M to adjust the minutes of the clock.
Press 00 to set the minutes to 00.
